name: Titanium.UI.ListView
summary: A list view is used to present information, organized in to sections and items, in a vertically-scrolling view.

events.name: indexclick
events.summary: Fired when the index bar is clicked by the user.
events.description: If the list view contains the sectionIndexTitles array of indices the index bar will appear on the side. This event will fire when this bar is clicked

properties.name: title
properties.summary: The title of the index clicked.

properties.name: index
properties.summary: The index number clicked.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: itemclick
events.summary: Fired when a list row is clicked by the user.
events.description: Do not rely on the source property to determine which item fired the event. Use the sectionIndex and itemIndex, or the itemId to determine the list item that generated the event, and use the bindId to check which child control fired the event.

properties.name: section
properties.summary: List section if the item is contained in a list section.

properties.name: sectionIndex
properties.summary: Section index.

properties.name: itemIndex
properties.summary: Item index.

properties.name: itemId
properties.summary: The item ID bound to the list item that generated the event.

properties.name: bindId
properties.summary: The bind ID of the control that generated this event, if one exists.

properties.name: accessoryClicked
properties.summary:
Returns `true` if the detail button is clicked else returns `false`.

Only returns `true` if the `accessoryType` property is set to
<Titanium.UI.LIST_ACCESSORY_TYPE_DETAIL>.  All other accessories return `false` if
clicked.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: delete
events.summary: Fired when a list row is deleted by the user.
events.description:
Do not rely on the source property to determine which item fired the event. Use the sectionIndex and itemIndex, or the itemId to determine the list item that generated the event, and use the bindId to check which child control fired the event.

Note that the sectionIndex and itemIndex properties of this event correspond to the List View state before the user action.

properties.name: section
properties.summary: List section from which the item is deleted.

properties.name: sectionIndex
properties.summary: Section index.

properties.name: itemIndex
properties.summary: Item index.

properties.name: itemId
properties.summary: The item ID bound to the list item that generated the event.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: false. This event does not bubble.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: insert
events.summary: Fired when a list row is inserted by the user.
events.description:
Do not rely on the source property to determine which item fired the event. Use the sectionIndex and itemIndex, or the itemId to determine the list item that generated the event, and use the bindId to check which child control fired the event.

Note that the sectionIndex and itemIndex properties of this event correspond to the List View state before the user action.

properties.name: section
properties.summary: List section from which the item is deleted.

properties.name: sectionIndex
properties.summary: Section index.

properties.name: itemIndex
properties.summary: Item index.

properties.name: itemId
properties.summary: The item ID bound to the list item that generated the event.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: false. This event does not bubble.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: dragstart
events.summary: Fired when the user starts dragging the list view.
events.description: Different to the pull event, this event does also fire when no pullView is specified and the user drags inside the list view.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: false. This event does not bubble.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: dragend
events.summary: Fired when the user stops dragging the list view.
events.description: Different to the pullend event, this event does also fire when no pullView is specified and the user drags inside the list view.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: false. This event does not bubble.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: marker
events.summary: Fired when the list view displays the reference item.
events.description: This event is fired only once per reference item. Use this in conjunction with the setMarker and addMarker methods. On iOS this method does not fire when list view is in search mode.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: false. This event does not bubble.

properties.name: sectionIndex
properties.summary: section index of the reference item.

properties.name: itemIndex
properties.summary: section item index of the reference item.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: move
events.summary: Fired when a list row is moved to a different location by the user.
events.description:
Do not rely on the source property to determine which item fired the event. Use the sectionIndex and itemIndex, or the itemId to determine the list item that generated the event, and use the bindId to check which child control fired the event.

Note that the sectionIndex,itemIndex,targetSectionIndex and targetItemIndex properties of this event correspond to the List View state before the user action.

properties.name: section
properties.summary: List section from which the item is moved.

properties.name: sectionIndex
properties.summary: Section index.

properties.name: itemIndex
properties.summary: Item index.

properties.name: targetSection
properties.summary: List section to which the item is moved. Might be the same as `section` property.

properties.name: targetSectionIndex
properties.summary: Section index.

properties.name: targetItemIndex
properties.summary: Position within the `targetSection`.

properties.name: itemId
properties.summary: The item ID bound to the list item that generated the event.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: false. This event does not bubble.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: noresults
events.summary: Fired when the search using either searchView or searchText has no results.
events.description:
When items are filtered in a list view using either the searchView or searchText, it is possible that the search returns an empty set.

While the searchView API automatically shows a No Results cell in the list view, the searchText API does not do so. Developers can listen to this event and perform appropriate actions when the search result set is empty.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: false. This event does not bubble.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: pull
events.summary: Fired when the user drags the list view past the top edge of the pullView.

properties.name: active
properties.summary: Determines if the `pullView` is completely visible (true) or partially hidden (false).

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: false. This event does not bubble.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: prefetch
events.summary: Fired when new list items are prefetched. The items are ordered ascending by geometric distance from the list view. Note that this event is only available on iOS 10 and later.
events.description: Use the sectionIndex and itemIndex, or the itemId to determine the list item that generated the event, and use the bindId to check which child control fired the event.

properties.name: prefetchedItems
properties.summary: An array of prefetched items.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: cancelprefetch
events.summary: Fired when list items that previously were considered as candidates for pre-fetching were not actually used. Note that this event is only available on iOS 10 and later
events.description: Use the sectionIndex and itemIndex, or the itemId to determine the list item that generated the event, and use the bindId to check which child control fired the event.

properties.name: prefetchedItems
properties.summary: An array of prefetched items.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: pullend
events.summary: Fired when the user stops dragging the list view and the pullView is completely visible.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: false. This event does not bubble.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: editaction
events.summary: Fired when the user interacts with one of the custom edit actions defined by editActions.
events.description:
Do not rely on the source property to determine which item fired the event. Use the sectionIndex and itemIndex, or the itemId to determine the list item that generated the event.

Note that the sectionIndex and itemIndex properties of this event correspond to the list view state before the user action.

properties.name: action
properties.summary: The [title](RowActionType.title) as defined in the row action object.

properties.name: identifier
properties.summary:
The [identifier](RowActionType. identifier) of the row action. Only included in the event 
if previously defined. Available in Titanium 6.0.0 and later.

properties.name: section
properties.summary: List section from which the event was generated.

properties.name: sectionIndex
properties.summary: Section index.

properties.name: itemIndex
properties.summary: Item index.

properties.name: itemId
properties.summary: The item ID bound to the list item that generated the event.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: false. This event does not bubble.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: scrollstart
events.summary: Fires when the list view starts scrolling by user interaction. Calling the scrollTo methods will not fire this event
events.description: This event will fire when the user starts scrolling the list view. Use the firstVisibleSectionIndex and the firstVisibleItemIndex to determine the position of the list view.

properties.name: visibleItemCount
properties.summary: The number of visible items in the list view when the event fires.

properties.name: firstVisibleItem
properties.summary: The first visible item in the list view when the event fires; this item might not be fully visible.

properties.name: firstVisibleSection
properties.summary: The first visible section in the list view when the event fires.

properties.name: firstVisibleItemIndex
properties.summary:
The index of the first visible item in the list view when the event fires; this item might not be fully visible.
Note: The index is `-1` when there are no items in the <Titanium.UI.ListView>.

properties.name: firstVisibleSectionIndex
properties.summary:
The index of the first visible section in the list view when the event fires.
Note: The index is `-1` when there are no items in the <Titanium.UI.ListView>.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: false. This event does not bubble.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: scrollend
events.summary: Fires when the list view ends scrolling. Calling the scrollTo methods will not fire this event
events.description: This event will fire when the list view ends scrolling. Use the firstVisibleSectionIndex and the firstVisibleItemIndex to determine the position of the list view.

properties.name: visibleItemCount
properties.summary: The number of visible items in the list view when the event fires.

properties.name: firstVisibleItem
properties.summary: The first visible item in the list view when the event fires; this item might not be fully visible.

properties.name: firstVisibleSection
properties.summary: The first visible section in the list view when the event fires.

properties.name: firstVisibleItemIndex
properties.summary: The index of the first visible item in the list view when the event fires; this item might not be fully visible.

properties.name: firstVisibleSectionIndex
properties.summary: The index of the first visible section in the list view when the event fires.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: false. This event does not bubble.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: scrolling
events.summary: Fires when the list view is scrolling. Calling the scrollTo methods will not fire this event
events.description: This event will fire while the list view is scrolling and the user releases the finger. On iOS no event is fired when the finger is not released. Use direction to determine the scroll direction, velocity to determine scroll speed, targetContentOffset to determine where the scrolling will end (in dpi). When direction is down, velocity is negative and viceversa. On Android velocity and targetContentOffset is 0.

properties.name: direction
properties.summary: Direction of the scroll either 'up', or 'down'.

properties.name: velocity
properties.summary: The velocity of the scroll in scale factor per second

properties.name: targetContentOffset
properties.summary: The expected y axis offset when the scrolling action decelerates to a stop.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

methods.name: addMarker
methods.summary: Adds a reference item in the list view.

parameters.name: markerProps
parameters.summary: Dictionary to describe the reference item.

methods.name: appendSection
methods.summary: Appends a single section or an array of sections to the end of the list.
methods.description: On iOS, the section(s) can be inserted with an animation by specifying the animation parameter.

parameters.name: section
parameters.summary: Section or sections to add to the list.

methods.name: deleteSectionAt
methods.description: On iOS, the section can be deleted with an animation by specifying the animation parameter.

parameters.name: sectionIndex
parameters.summary: Index of the section to delete.

methods.name: insertSectionAt
methods.summary: Inserts a section or an array of sections at a specific index.
methods.description:
Existing sections at that index and after are pushed down.

On iOS, the section(s) may be inserted with an animation by setting the animation parameter.

parameters.name: sectionIndex
parameters.summary: Index of the section to insert before.

methods.name: replaceSectionAt
methods.description: On iOS, the section may be replaced with an animation by setting the animation parameter.

parameters.name: sectionIndex
parameters.summary: Index of the section to update.

methods.name: scrollToItem
methods.description:
On Android 4.x, the list does not stop at the correct position. This is a known bug in Android. (Android Issue #37278)

Android added support for the animation parameter in Release 3.3.0 on the Titanium SDK.

methods.name: selectItem
methods.summary: Selects an item in the list using the specified item and section indices.

parameters.name: sectionIndex
parameters.summary: Index of the section the item is in.

parameters.name: itemIndex
parameters.summary: Index of the item to select.

methods.name: setContentInsets
methods.description:
A list view is essentially a scroll view that contains a set of static row views that represents the content. Thus, the setContentInsets method facilitates a margin, or inset, distance between the content and the container scroll view.

Typically used with the pullView property.

parameters.name: animated
parameters.summary: Determines whether, and how, the content inset change should be animated.

methods.name: setContentOffset
methods.summary: Sets the value of the content offset of the list view without animation by default.

parameters.name: contentOffset
parameters.summary:
Dictionary with the properties `x`, `y`. Pass in `animated` `true` as a second dictionary parameter.
The `x` and `y` coordinates reposition the top-left point of the scrollable region of the list view.
The `animated` property is optional and set to `false` by default.

methods.name: setMarker
methods.summary: Sets a reference item in the list view.
methods.description: This method replaces previous reference items with the current one. See marker event for details.

parameters.name: markerProps
parameters.summary: Dictionary to describe the reference item.

properties.name: sectionIndexTitles
properties.summary: Determines whether multiple items of this list view can be selected at the same time while editing the table.

properties.name: allowsSelection
properties.summary: Determines whether this item can be selected.
properties.description:
Set to false to prevent the item from being selected.

On iOS, even if this property is set to false, you can interact with the detail disclosure accessory (accessoryType set to LIST_ACCESSORY_TYPE_DETAIL) and any child templates that are controls, such as a button, slider, etc.

properties.name: allowsSelectionDuringEditing
properties.summary: Determines whether this list view items can be selected while editing the table.

properties.name: canScroll
properties.summary: Determines if the list view can scroll in response to user actions.
properties.description: Set to false to disable scrolling.

properties.name: caseInsensitiveSearch
properties.summary: Determines if the search performed is case insensitive.
properties.description: Used in conjunction with searchView and searchText properties of List View and searchableText property of List Item.

properties.name: defaultItemTemplate
properties.summary: Sets the default template for list data items that do not specify the template property.
properties.description:
Can be set to any of the built-in templates or those defined in the templates property.

Can be changed dynamically.

properties.name: dimBackgroundForSearch
properties.summary: A Boolean indicating whether the underlying content is dimmed during a search.
properties.description: If you do not want to show the dimmed background when clicking on the search bar, set this property false during creation.

properties.name: disableBounce
properties.summary: Determines whether the scroll-bounce of the list view should be disabled.
properties.description: Set to true to disable the vertical bounce.

properties.name: editing
properties.summary: Determines if the list view is currently in editing mode.
properties.description: For more information see the "Editing Support" section of Titanium.UI.ListView.

properties.name: footerDividersEnabled
properties.summary: When set to false, the ListView will not draw the divider before the footer view.

properties.name: footerTitle
properties.summary: List view footer title.

properties.name: footerView
properties.summary: List view footer as a view that will be rendered instead of a label.
properties.description: In Alloy you can specify this property with a <FooterView> child element of a <ListView> element (see Examples). On Android, this is a creation only property.

properties.name: headerDividersEnabled
properties.summary: When set to false, the ListView will not draw the divider after the header view.

properties.name: headerTitle
properties.summary: List view header title.

properties.name: headerView
properties.summary: List view header as a view that will be rendered instead of a label.
properties.description: On Android, this is a creation only property. In Alloy you can specify this property with a <HeaderView> child element of a <ListView> element (see Examples).

properties.name: keepSectionsInSearch
properties.summary: Determines if the section information is displayed in the search results when using the searchText property.
properties.description: Used in conjunction with searchText property of List View and searchableText property of List Item.

properties.name: keyboardDismissMode
properties.summary: The manner in which the keyboard is dismissed when a drag begins in the list view.

properties.name: lazyLoadingEnabled
properties.summary: Determines if the list view should use lazy loading to load remote images.
properties.description: Lazy loading is used to load remote images only if they are in the visible view area. It is enabled by default. If you disable it, images will be loaded even if they are currently not visible. Disabling improves the loading of images, but can also cause trouble in list views having a lot of remote images, because every remote image opens a new HTTP request.

properties.name: listSeparatorInsets
properties.summary: The insets for the list view header and footer.
properties.description:
Cell separators do not extend all the way to the edge of the list view. Set this to a dictionary with two keys, left specifying inset from left edge and right specifying the inset from the right edge. If the rowSeparatorInsets is not set, the listSeparatorInsets will also set the cell insets.

For example:

 listView.setListSeparatorInsets({
     left:10,
     right:10
 });

properties.name: pruneSectionsOnEdit
properties.summary: Determines if empty sections are retained when the user completes editing the list view.
properties.description: For more information see the "Editing Support" section of Titanium.UI.ListView.

properties.name: pullView
properties.summary: View positioned above the first row that is only revealed when the user drags the list view contents down.
properties.description:
A pullView is a UI control that is often used to provide a convenient way for the user to refresh a table's data. Typically used in conjunction with setContentInsets method and pull and pullend events.

To specify the wrapper color see pullBackgroundColor.

In Alloy you can assign this property with a <PullView> child element of a <ListView> element:

<Alloy>
  <ListView>
    <ListSection>
      <ListItem title="Item a"></ListItem>
      <ListItem title="Item b"></ListItem>
      <ListItem title="Item c"></ListItem>
    </ListSection>
    <PullView>
      <View height="50" backgroundColor="black">
        <Label/>
      </View>
    </PullView>
  </ListView>
</Alloy>

See the code example on pullView to see how it may be utilized.

properties.name: refreshControl
properties.summary: View positioned above the first row that is only revealed when the user drags the list view contents down.
properties.description: An alternate to the pullView property. See Titanium.UI.RefreshControl for usage and examples.

properties.name: resultsBackgroundColor
properties.summary: The background color of the search results (iOS-only).
properties.description: For information about color values, see the "Colors" section of Titanium.UI. Note: A transparent background-color is not officially supported by Apple to prevent that the list of results overlaps with the list view below it.

properties.name: resultsSeparatorColor
properties.summary: Separator line color between rows inside search results, as a color name or hex triplet (iOS-only).
properties.description: To make the line invisible, set this property to transparent, or the same value as the backgroundColor property. For information about color values, see the "Colors" section of Titanium.UI.

properties.name: resultsSeparatorInsets
properties.summary: The insets for search results separators (applies to all cells & iOS-only).
properties.description: Cell separators do not extend all the way to the edge of the list view. This property sets the default inset for all cells in the table. Set this to a dictionary with two keys, left specifying inset from left edge and right specifying the inset from the right edge.

properties.name: resultsSeparatorStyle
properties.summary: The separator style of the search results (iOS-only).

properties.name: rowSeparatorInsets
properties.summary: The insets for list view cells (applies to all cells).
properties.description:
Cell separators do not extend all the way to the edge of the list view. Set this to a dictionary with two keys, left specifying inset from left edge and right specifying the inset from the right edge. This property is only available upon creation of the cells.

For example:

 listView.setRowSeparatorInsets({
     left:10,
     right:10
 });

properties.name: scrollIndicatorStyle
properties.summary: Style of the scrollbar.

properties.name: searchText
properties.summary: The string to use as the search parameter.
properties.description:
Provides a generic search API for the List View. This property can not be used when the searchView property is set. Used in conjunction with caseInsensitiveSearch property of List View and searchableText property of List Item.

On iOS, when using this property the style property of the List View is honored. If the keepSectionsInSearch property is set to true then section information is preserved in the search results, otherwise the search results are displayed in a single section.

properties.name: searchView
properties.summary: Search field to use for the list view.
properties.description:
Provides the same functionality as the search property in Titanium.UI.TableView. Used in conjunction with caseInsensitiveSearch property of List View and searchableText property of List Item.

On Android, you can either specify Titanium.UI.SearchBar or Titanium.UI.Android.SearchView, while on iOS only Titanium.UI.SearchBar is supported.

In an Alloy application, you can use a <SearchView> or <SearchBar> element inside a <ListView> element.

<Alloy>
    <ListView>
       <!-- search, shorthand with Ti.UI.SearchBar -->
      <SearchBar class="search" platform="ios"/>
      <!-- search, shorthand with Ti.UI.Android.SearchView -->
      <SearchView ns="Ti.UI.Android" class="search" platform="android"/>
    </ListView>
</Alloy>

properties.name: sectionCount
properties.summary: Number of sections in this list view.

properties.name: sectionIndexTitles
properties.summary: Array of objects (with title and index properties) to control the list view index.
properties.description: If an index array is specified, an index bar is displayed on the right-hand side of the list view. Clicking on a title in the index bar scrolls the list view to the section index associated with that title.

properties.name: sections
properties.summary: Sections of this list.

properties.name: selectedItems
properties.summary: Returns the selected list view items.

properties.name: separatorColor
properties.summary: Separator line color between items, as a color name or hex triplet.
properties.description: To make the line invisible, set this property to transparent, or the same value as the backgroundColor property. For information about color values, see the "Colors" section of Titanium.UI.

properties.name: separatorHeight
properties.summary: height of the ListView separator.
properties.description: Height of the ListView separator, in platform-specific units. If undefined, default native height will be used. Numerical inputs are treated as pixels. For example, 3 and "3px" are equivalent.

properties.name: separatorInsets
properties.summary: The insets for list view separators (applies to all cells).
properties.description: Cell separators do not extend all the way to the edge of the list view. This property sets the default inset for all cells in the table. Set this to a dictionary with two keys, left specifying inset from left edge and right specifying the inset from the right edge.

properties.name: separatorStyle
properties.summary: Separator style constant.

properties.name: showVerticalScrollIndicator
properties.summary: Determines whether this list view displays a vertical scroll indicator.
properties.description: Set to false to hide the vertical scroll indicator.

properties.name: style
properties.summary: Style of the list view.
properties.description: Style should always be set before setting the sections on list view.

properties.name: tableSeparatorInsets
properties.summary: The insets for the table view header and footer.
properties.description:
Cell separators do not extend all the way to the edge of the list view. Set this to a dictionary with two keys, left specifying inset from left edge and right specifying the inset from the right edge. If the rowSeparatorInsets is not set, the tableSeparatorInsets will also set the cell insets.

For example:

 listView.setTableSeparatorInsets({
     left:10,
     right:10
 });

properties.name: templates
properties.summary: Contain key-value pairs mapping a style name (key) to an ItemTemplate (value).
properties.description: This property cannot be changed once a window has been opened.

properties.name: willScrollOnStatusTap
properties.summary: Controls the scroll-to-top gesture.
properties.description: If the user taps on the status bar, the view scrolls to the top. This gesture works when you have a single visible list view. If there are multiple list views, table views, web views, text areas, and/or scroll views visible, you need to disable (set to false) this property on the views you DO NOT want to enable this behavior for. The remaining view responds to the scroll-to-top gesture.
